text: Hoodia ruschii is a species of stem succulent plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is endemic to Namibia. Its natural habitats are rocky areas and cold desert. ==Description== Hoodia ruschii reaches about 1/2 meter in height and has stout, grayish green stems covered in sharp, hard spines. It bears deep reddish-brown flowers which are medium-sized. ==References== Category:Endemic flora of Namibia ruschii Category:Least concern plants Category:Succulent plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Hoodia ruschii
